episodeTitle: A Fierce Battle Gets Heated! Luffy vs. Caesar!
episodeTitleJapanese: 白熱の激戦 ルフィVSシーザー
episodeTitleRomanized: Hakunetsu no Gekisen - Rufi tai Shīzā
description: Luffy confronts Caesar Clown in a heated battle while Sanji faces off against Vergo. As Caesar attempts to drain oxygen from the room, Luffy activates Gear Second and uses Haki-infused attacks. Meanwhile, Law infiltrates the SAD production facility, and Monet reveals her snow-based Devil Fruit powers to protect Caesar.

events.title: Luffy vs. Caesar Battle Begins
events.description: Luffy finally reaches Caesar's laboratory and immediately launches a powerful punch that sends the scientist crashing into the wall. This marks the beginning of their fierce confrontation as Luffy seeks to capture Caesar for Law's plan.
events.significance: This battle is crucial to the alliance's plan to take down a Yonko. Capturing Caesar is the first step in disrupting Doflamingo's operations and the artificial Devil Fruit production.

quotes.text: I'm gonna beat you up and take you with me!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his intention to capture Caesar

events.title: Sanji vs. Vergo Confrontation
events.description: Sanji engages in combat with Vergo at the passage connecting buildings A and B. The two clash as the facility begins its lockdown sequence with poison gas flooding the area.
events.significance: This battle showcases Sanji's growth in the New World and reveals Vergo's formidable power as a Vice Admiral and undercover agent. It also creates tension as both fighters must escape the encroaching poison gas.

events.title: Caesar's Karakuni - Oxygen Deprivation Attack
events.description: Caesar attempts to kill Luffy by draining the oxygen from the room using his Gasu Gasu no Mi powers. The technique removes breathable air from the environment to suffocate his opponents.
events.significance: Demonstrates Caesar's lethal fighting style and his willingness to use deadly gas-based attacks. This showcases the danger of his Devil Fruit abilities.

quotes.text: Let's see how long you can last without oxygen, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar taunts Luffy while draining oxygen from the room

events.title: Luffy Uses Gear Second Against Caesar
events.description: In response to Caesar's oxygen deprivation attack, Luffy activates Gear Second to increase his speed and power. The enhanced blood flow and metabolism allow him to continue fighting despite the lack of oxygen.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's strategic thinking in using Gear Second not just for speed, but to maintain his body's functions in an oxygen-deprived environment. Demonstrates his growth and adaptability in the New World.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy activates his power-up to counter Caesar's attack

events.title: Luffy Uses Haki-Infused Attacks
events.description: Luffy employs Busoshoku Haki (Armament Haki) in his attacks against Caesar, coating his fists in the invisible armor to strike the Logia Devil Fruit user. This forces Caesar to take damage despite his gas-based intangibility.
events.significance: Reinforces that Luffy has mastered Haki during the timeskip and can now fight Logia users effectively. This is essential for battles in the New World against powerful Devil Fruit users.

events.title: Sanji's Flanchet Strike
events.description: Sanji debuts his Flanchet Strike technique against Vergo, delivering a powerful kick during their battle in the passage between buildings A and B.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's new techniques developed during the timeskip on Kamabakka Kingdom. Shows his continued growth as a fighter in the New World.

events.title: Vergo's Durability Displayed
events.description: Vergo demonstrates remarkable physical durability and defense, withstanding Sanji's powerful Flanchet Strike. His body appears incredibly tough, hinting at his advanced Haki abilities.
events.significance: Establishes Vergo as a formidable opponent and foreshadows his Full Body Armament Haki abilities. Shows that Vice Admirals in the New World are on a different level.

events.title: Caesar's Blue Sword
events.description: Caesar creates an oxygen-based flame sword called Blue Sword by concentrating oxygen on a bladeless weapon that doubles as a lighter. The blue flame blade is extremely hot and can burn opponents while cutting them.
events.significance: Showcases Caesar's creative use of his gas manipulation abilities to create deadly weapons. The technique demonstrates his scientific knowledge combined with Devil Fruit powers.

events.title: Caesar's Nenshokei: Miok Gas
events.description: Caesar uses Nenshokei (Combustion System): Miok Gas, concentrating flammable gas in an area and then igniting it with lit matches to create a massive fireball that incinerates everything inside.
events.significance: Reveals the deadly and indiscriminate nature of Caesar's attacks. This technique shows why he's considered extremely dangerous and why capturing him is so important.

events.title: Law Infiltrates SAD Production Room
events.description: Trafalgar Law successfully infiltrates Building D where the SAD (synthetic Devil Fruit material) is being produced. An emergency broadcast announces his invasion, alerting both Caesar and Vergo to his presence.
events.significance: This is a crucial step in Law's plan to destroy the SAD production and cripple Doflamingo's SMILE factory operations. It reveals Law's true objective on Punk Hazard.

events.title: Monet's Yuki Yuki no Mi Powers Revealed
events.description: Monet reveals her Yuki Yuki no Mi (Snow-Snow Fruit) Devil Fruit powers for the first time in the anime, creating a snow wall (Kamakura) to protect Caesar from Luffy's attacks. This establishes her as a Logia-type Devil Fruit user with snow manipulation abilities.
events.significance: This is the first on-screen appearance of Monet's Devil Fruit abilities in the anime. As a Logia user, she becomes a significant obstacle and showcases the variety of Devil Fruit types Doflamingo has recruited for his operations.

quotes.text: I can't let you harm Master Caesar. Joker would kill me if anything happened to him.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet explains her motivation for protecting Caesar

events.title: Monet's Kamakura
events.description: Monet uses her first demonstrated technique, Kamakura, creating a protective snow wall/dome to shield Caesar from Luffy's attacks. The technique shows her defensive capabilities with her snow powers.
events.significance: First display of Monet's snow manipulation techniques, establishing her combat style and role as Caesar's protector.

events.title: Doflamingo's Connection to Punk Hazard Confirmed
events.description: Monet mentions 'Joker' (Doflamingo's underworld alias) when explaining why she must protect Caesar, confirming Doflamingo's direct involvement in Caesar's operations and the SAD production on Punk Hazard.
events.significance: This revelation connects the Punk Hazard arc directly to Doflamingo and sets up the Dressrosa arc. It establishes the larger conspiracy involving a Warlord of the Sea in illegal Devil Fruit production.

quotes.text: Joker would kill me if anything happened to him.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet reveals her fear of Doflamingo's retribution

events.title: Smoker Leaves to Find Vergo
events.description: Smoker departs from Luffy's battle area to search for Vergo, the traitor within the Marines who is working with Caesar and Doflamingo.
events.significance: Sets up the eventual confrontation between Smoker and Vergo, revealing the betrayal within the Marine ranks.

events.title: Poison Gas Flooding Buildings
events.description: The facility's lockdown causes poison gas to begin flooding into the passages between buildings. Both Sanji and Vergo must flee as the deadly Shinokuni gas spreads through Punk Hazard.
events.significance: Creates urgency and raises the stakes for all characters on Punk Hazard. The spreading gas serves as a ticking clock forcing everyone to escape the island.

quotes.text: I'm gonna beat you up and take you with me!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration to Caesar at the start of their battle

quotes.text: Let's see how long you can last without oxygen, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar taunts Luffy while using his oxygen deprivation attack

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy activates his power-up to counter Caesar's oxygen attack

quotes.text: I can't let you harm Master Caesar. Joker would kill me if anything happened to him.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet reveals her loyalty to Doflamingo while protecting Caesar

themes.description: The episode highlights Caesar's complete disregard for ethics in his pursuit of scientific achievement, using deadly gas weapons without concern for innocent lives.
themes.symbolism: Caesar's laboratory represents the corruption of science when divorced from morality.

themes.description: Multiple forms of loyalty are explored: Monet's fearful loyalty to Doflamingo, Vergo's betrayal of the Marines, and Law's commitment to his alliance with Luffy.
themes.symbolism: The poison gas flooding the facility symbolizes the toxic nature of betrayal spreading through the organization.

themes.description: Luffy demonstrates strategic thinking by using Gear Second to counter oxygen deprivation, showing his growth beyond simply overpowering opponents.
themes.symbolism: The battle showcases the evolution from brute force to tactical combat in the New World.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his post-timeskip abilities, using both Gear Second and Haki strategically against Caesar. His determination to capture Caesar for Law's plan shows his commitment to the alliance.
keyActions: Confronts Caesar directly with a powerful opening punch
Activates Gear Second to overcome oxygen deprivation
Uses Armament Haki to strike Caesar's Logia body
quotes: I'm gonna beat you up and take you with me!

characterSpotlights.development: Caesar reveals multiple deadly techniques showcasing his mastery of gas manipulation. His desperation and anger grow as Luffy proves resistant to his attacks.
keyActions: Attempts to suffocate Luffy by removing oxygen
Creates Blue Sword with concentrated oxygen flames
Uses Nenshokei: Miok Gas combustion attack
quotes: Let's see how long you can last without oxygen, Straw Hat!

characterSpotlights.development: Monet's Devil Fruit powers are revealed for the first time, establishing her as a Logia user and Caesar's dedicated protector. Her fear of Doflamingo's retribution explains her motivation.
keyActions: Reveals Yuki Yuki no Mi (Snow-Snow Fruit) powers
Uses Kamakura to create protective snow barrier
quotes: I can't let you harm Master Caesar. Joker would kill me if anything happened to him.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji engages in serious combat with Vergo, showcasing his post-timeskip techniques. The battle tests his abilities against a Vice Admiral-level opponent.
keyActions: Battles Vergo in the passage between buildings
Must flee from the approaching poison gas

characterSpotlights.development: Law executes his plan by infiltrating the SAD production facility, revealing his strategic thinking and true objective on Punk Hazard.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences between Luffy vs. Caesar and Sanji vs. Vergo with additional animation and combat choreography not present in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts material from pages 2-19 of Chapter 681 of the manga.
Episode 607 received a TV rating of 7.3%, ranking 5th in its time slot for the week it aired in Japan.
The episode was directed by Takashi Ōtsuka with screenplay by Yoshiyuki Suga, who were part of the regular rotation for the Punk Hazard arc.
This episode marks the first anime appearance of Monet's Yuki Yuki no Mi Devil Fruit powers, though she had appeared in earlier episodes without using them.
Ryusei Nakao, who voices Caesar Clown, is also famous for voicing Frieza in Dragon Ball Z and Mayuri Kurotsuchi in Bleach.
